byline.original: By RAYMOND DANIELL Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Brit defense authorities concerned with possibility of German capture of Ireland (Eire); suggested that Polish, Czech and French legions be sent to Northern Ireland to await call from Eire; speculation on German method of capturing Ireland
snippet: LONDON, July 1--Neutral Ireland [Eire], unprepared for war, wracked by factionalism and suspicious of Great Britain, is causing increasing concern among those charged with the duty of defending this country from invasion and maintaining communicat...

headline.main: IRELAND'S DEFENSE WORRIES BRITAIN; Secrecy Surrounds Talks With Dublin and Belfast to Draft a Unified Plan BASE FOR INVASION SEEN Strategists Say Nazis Could Send Troops by Plane From Brittany or Iceland

lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 1--Neutral Ireland [Eire], unprepared for war, wracked by factionalism and suspicious of Great Britain, is causing increasing concern among those charged with the duty of defending this country from invasion and maintaining communications with the rest of the empire and the world.
